sentence.Network_en: A bond is a promissory note, usually issued for a specified amount.
sentence.Network_cn: 债券是一种期票, 通常以一定数额发行.

sentence.Network_en: Promissory notes were generally used as evidence of debt.
sentence.Network_cn: 本票以前一般是用作借据.

sentence.Network_en: All the promissory notes were dished out on the campaign trail.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有的本票在竞选活动中都分发下去了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin promissorius, from promiss- 'promised', from the verb promittere (see promise)

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or having the character of a promise;
